X12 Package¶

x12¶

The bulk of this package is defined by extraction from other sources. Specifically the tools.pyx12_extract module.

The only part written by hans is the x12.base module.

x12.base¶

Base definitions for X12 message constructs:

  • Element

  • Composite

  • Segment

  • Loop

  • Message

Each of these has an internal structure defined in a Schema class definition. This definition often has only a single value, schema, with the JSONSchema object.

class x12.base.Composite¶

A composite of atomic elements.

class x12.base.Element¶

An atomic element.

This has a value attribute and a schema attribute.

class x12.base.Loop¶

A Segment that repeats.

class x12.base.Segment¶

A collection of Elements or Composites.

TODO: How are composite values distributed? A composite isn’t a named segment, really.

class x12.base.Source(text: str)¶

State invariant: text[pos] is the start of a segment. For the initial ISA segment; there’s no defined element_sep.

elements() → list[str] | str¶

Unpack a Segment or Loop’s text into a list of potential Element values.

Note the initial ISA segment is fixed length, not compressed. Separators aren’t defined yet.
